00048 #include <stdio.h>
00049 #include <stdlib.h>

00053 #include "base.h"
00054 #include "library.h"
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * \addtogroup  DataTypes
00058  * \brief Data types of the library.
00059  *   
00060  * \description
00061  *
00062  *    The possible values of many types of data are represented with
00063  *    enumerations. This module contains the enum declarations and some basic
00064  *    functions for manipulating them.
00065  */
00066 
00067 /**
00068  * \addtogroup  DataInterface
00069  * \brief  Primary interface between computational routines and 
00070  *         actual data. 
00071  *
00072  * \description
00073  *  
00074  *    The routines in this section are the primary interface between the
00075  *    computational routines in the Feature Characterization library and
00076  *    the actual data.  
00077  *
00078  *    There are five major data entities: datasets, sequences, meshes, subsets,
00079  *    and variables which follow this basic hierarchy (the library owns
00080  *    everything):
00081  *
00082  *     - Library
00083  *     - Dataset
00084  *     - Sequence
00085  *     - Mesh
00086  *     - Subset
00087  *     - Variable & Sequence Variable 
00088  *
00089  *    The data interface routines allow the calling code to get, query, copy,
00090  *    and delete each of these types of objects. In addition, you can
00091  *    load and write datasets. The objects are
00092  *    manipulated via opaque handles (see \ref Handles). These handles can be 
00093  *    assigned directly using '=', but cannot be checked for equality using 
00094  *    '==', so you must use \ref FC_HANDLE_EQUIV instead.
00095  *
00096  *    As a quick review, the library manages multiple datasets and each
00097  *    dataset can have multiple meshes. A sequence is the coordinates of 
00098  *    a parameter space orthogonal to the space of the mesh. The most common 
00099  *    type of sequence would be the time values of a time series. 
00100  *    A subset is a set of mesh subentities (e.g. vertices or elements).
00101  *    A variable is a function, such as temperature, over a mesh. It is
00102  *    associated with some subentity of a mesh such as vertices or
00103  *    elements. A sequence variable is actually an array of variable handles
00104  *    associated with a sequence, with one variable per step of the
00105  *    sequence.
00106  *
00107  *    It is very important to note that the library makes a distinction
00108  *    between meta data and "big data", and that access to these is treated
00109  *    very differently.
00110  *    Big data are the really large arrays of data that we want to 
00111  *    avoid duplicating or moving around. Currently, the coordinate arrays for
00112  *    the meshes and the sequences, and the data from the variables, are
00113  *    considered big data and everything else is meta data.
00114  *
00115  *    When users ask for metadata they get copies of the data and can
00116  *    manipulate it however they want, and they are responsible for freeing any
00117  *    arrays. On the other hand, when users ask for big data, they get a
00118  *    pointer to the original data (the names of such routines will end with
00119  *    'Ptr'). Users should treat this pointer as read only.  Users should never
00120  *    free big data directly, but should used the release and delete routines
00121  *    to try free up big data or to delete the
00122  *    entity that the big data is in.
00123  */
00124 
00125 /**
00126  * \addtogroup  Handles
00127  * \brief Data objects handled through opaque handles.
00128  *   
00129  * \description
00130  *
00131  *    Handles are used to look up the appropriate data structure in
00132  *    the library's internals. Handles can be assigned 
00133  *    to (copies contents) with '=', but cannot be tested with '==',
00134  *    use \ref FC_HANDLE_EQUIV().
00135  *
00136  *    All of the handles have the same form
00137  *    (a struct containing the slot id and the sequence id), the library
00138  *    declares them as different types to clarify the user API and to add 
00139  *    more compile time type checking. But because they have the same
00140  *    form, general purpose routines and macros (like checking that a
00141  *    handle is valid) can be written. 
00142  *
00143  *    See \ref DataInterface for an explanation of using the data objects.
00144  */
00145 
00146 /** 
00147  * \name Check that an enum has a valid value
00148  * 
00149  * These routines return true (1) if the int passed is a valid value for the
00150  * enumerated type, and false (0) if it is not. Enum values of the type 
00151  * FC_X_UNKNOWN are considered valid because they are possible values of the
00152  * enum. In many cases you may want to check for a "good" value and should
00153  * check "fc_isXValid(value) && value != FC_X_UNKNOWN".
00154  */
00155 //-------------------------------
00156 //@{
00157 
00158 /**
00159  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00160  * \brief  Verify that the given value is valid for this enum
00161  *
00162  * \modifications   
00163  *    - 8/18/04 WSK, Created
00164  */
00165 int fc_isVerbosityLevelValid(
00166   FC_VerbosityLevel verbosity   
00167 ) 
00168 {
00169   switch(verbosity) {
00170   case FC_QUIET:             // fall through
00171   case FC_ERROR_MESSAGES:    // fall through
00172   case FC_WARNING_MESSAGES:  // fall through
00173   case FC_LOG_MESSAGES:      // fall through
00174   case FC_DEBUG_MESSAGES:    // fall through
00175   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00176     return 1;
00177   }
00178   return 0;
00179 }
00180 
00181 /**
00182  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00183  * \brief  Verify that the given value is valid for this enum
00184  *
00185  * \modifications   
00186  *    - 8/18/04 WSK, Created
00187  */
00188 int fc_isReturnCodeValid(
00189   FC_ReturnCode rc      /**< input - enum to return printable string for */
00190 ) 
00191 {
00192   switch(rc) {
00193   case FC_SUCCESS:        // fall through
00194   case FC_ERROR:          // fall through
00195   case FC_MEMORY_ERROR:   // fall through
00196   case FC_INPUT_ERROR:    // fall through
00197   case FC_FILE_IO_ERROR:  // fall through
00198   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00199     return 1;
00200   }
00201   return 0;
00202 }
00203 
00204 /**
00205  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00206  * \brief  Verify that the given value is valid for this enum
00207  *
00208  * \modifications   
00209  *    - 8/18/04 WSK, Created
00210  */
00211 int fc_isElementTypeValid(
00212   FC_ElementType elemType   
00213 ) 
00214 {
00215   switch(elemType) {
00216   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:  // fall through
00217   case FC_ET_POINT:    // fall through
00218   case FC_ET_LINE:     // fall through
00219   case FC_ET_TRI:      // fall through
00220   case FC_ET_QUAD:     // fall through
00221   case FC_ET_TET:      // fall through
00222   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  // fall through
00223   case FC_ET_PRISM:    // fall through
00224   case FC_ET_HEX:      // fall through
00225   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through
00226   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00227     return 1;
00228   }
00229   return 0;
00230 }
00231 
00232 /**
00233  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00234  * \brief  Verify that the given value is valid for this enum
00235  *
00236  * \modifications   
00237  *    - 8/18/04 WSK, Created
00238  */
00239 int fc_isDataTypeValid(
00240   FC_DataType dataType
00241 ) 
00242 {
00243   switch (dataType) {
00244   case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:  // fall through
00245   case FC_DT_CHAR:     // fall through
00246   case FC_DT_INT:      // fall through
00247   case FC_DT_FLOAT:    // fall through
00248   case FC_DT_DOUBLE:   // fall through
00249   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00250     return 1;
00251   }
00252   return 0;
00253 }
00254 
00255 /**
00256  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00257  * \brief  Verify that the given value is valid for this enum
00258  *
00259  * \modifications   
00260  *    - 8/18/04 WSK, Created
00261  */
00262 int fc_isMathTypeValid(
00263  FC_MathType mathtype
00264 ) 
00265 {
00266   switch (mathtype) {
00267   case FC_MT_UNKNOWN:    // fall through
00268   case FC_MT_SCALAR:     // fall through
00269   case FC_MT_VECTOR:     // fall through
00270   case FC_MT_SYMTENSOR:  // fall through
00271   case FC_MT_TENSOR:     // fall through
00272   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00273     return 1;
00274   }
00275   return 0;
00276 }
00277 
00278 /**
00279  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00280  * \brief  Verify that the given value is valid for this enum
00281  *
00282  * \modifications   
00283  *    - 8/18/04 WSK, Created
00284  */
00285 int fc_isAssociationTypeValid(
00286   FC_AssociationType assoc
00287 ) 
00288 {
00289   switch (assoc) {
00290   case FC_AT_UNKNOWN:  // fall through
00291   case FC_AT_VERTEX:   // fall through
00292   case FC_AT_EDGE:     // fall through
00293   case FC_AT_FACE:     // fall through
00294   case FC_AT_ELEMENT:  // fall through
00295   case FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH:    // fall through
00296   case FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET: // fall through
00297   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00298     return 1;
00299   }
00300   return 0;
00301 }

00303 //@}

00305 /** 
00306  * \name Get the name of an enum value as text
00307  *
00308  * These routines return a text string holding the name of the enum value.
00309  * If the enum value is invalid, they return NULL. The returned string 
00310  * should NOT be freed.
00311  */
00312 //-------------------------------
00313 //@{
00314 
00315 /**
00316  * \ingroup   DataTypes
00317  * \brief  Return the name of the \ref FC_VerbosityLevel's value.
00318  *
00319  * \description
00320  *
00321  *    Returns a string representing the name of the enum value or
00322  *    NULL is the enum value is invalid. The string should NOT be freed.
00323  * 
00324  * \modifications   
00325  *    - 3/30/04 WSK, Created
00326  */
00327 char *fc_getVerbosityLevelText(
00328   FC_VerbosityLevel verbosity   
00329 ) 
00330 {
00331   switch(verbosity) {
00332   case FC_QUIET:             return "FC_QUIET";
00333   case FC_ERROR_MESSAGES:    return "FC_ERROR_MESSAGES";
00334   case FC_WARNING_MESSAGES:  return "FC_WARNING_MESSAGES";
00335   case FC_LOG_MESSAGES:      return "FC_LOG_MESSAGES";
00336   case FC_DEBUG_MESSAGES:    return "FC_DEBUG_MESSAGES";
00337   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00338   }
00339   return NULL;
00340 }
00341 
00342 /**
00343  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00344  * \brief  Return the name of the \ref FC_ReturnCode's value.
00345  *
00346  * \description
00347  *  
00348  *    Returns a string representing the name of the enum value or
00349  *    NULL is the enum value is invalid. The string should NOT be freed.
00350  * 
00351  * \modifications 
00352  *    - 2003-SEP-22  W Koegler  Created
00353  */
00354 char *fc_getReturnCodeText(
00355   FC_ReturnCode rc      /**< input - enum to return printable string for */
00356 ) 
00357 {
00358     switch(rc) {
00359       case FC_SUCCESS:          return "FC_SUCCESS";
00360       case FC_ERROR:            return "FC_ERROR";
00361       case FC_MEMORY_ERROR:     return "FC_MEMORY_ERROR";
00362       case FC_INPUT_ERROR:      return "FC_INPUT_ERROR";
00363       case FC_FILE_IO_ERROR:    return "FC_FILE_IO_ERROR";
00364       // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00365     }
00366 
00367     return NULL;
00368 }
00369 
00370 /**
00371  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00372  * \brief  Return the name of the \ref FC_ElementType's value.
00373  *
00374  * \description
00375  *
00376  *    Returns a string representing the name of the enum value or
00377  *    NULL is the enum value is invalid. The string should NOT be freed.
00378  *
00379  * \modifications   
00380  *    - Nancy Collins  Created.
00381  *    - 2003-NOV-17  WSK  Changed to return the enum values' name instead
00382  *      of more human readable word.
00383  */
00384 char *fc_getElementTypeText(
00385   FC_ElementType elemType   
00386 ) 
00387 {
00388   switch(elemType) {
00389   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:    return "FC_ET_UNKNOWN";
00390   case FC_ET_POINT:      return "FC_ET_POINT";
00391   case FC_ET_LINE:       return "FC_ET_LINE";
00392   case FC_ET_TRI:        return "FC_ET_TRI";
00393   case FC_ET_QUAD:       return "FC_ET_QUAD";
00394   case FC_ET_TET:        return "FC_ET_TET";
00395   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:    return "FC_ET_PYRAMID";
00396   case FC_ET_PRISM:      return "FC_ET_PRISM";
00397   case FC_ET_HEX:        return "FC_ET_HEX";
00398   case FC_ET_MIXED:      return "FC_ET_MIXED";
00399   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00400   }
00401   return NULL;
00402 }

00495 /** \name Get information about an FC_ElementType */
00496 //-------------------------------
00497 //@{
00498 
00499 /**
00500  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00501  * \brief  Returns number of topological dimensions for a type of element.
00502  *
00503  * \description
00504  *
00505  *    Returns the topological dimensionality of the type of element.
00506  *    If the type is unknown (FC_ET_UNKNOWN), -1 is returned.
00507  *
00508  * \modifications  
00509  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
00510  *    - 2003-NOV-17 WSK Changed to return topodim instead of
00511  *      passing back out in argument list.
00512  */
00513 int fc_getElementTypeTopoDim(
00514   FC_ElementType elemType
00515 ) 
00516 { 
00517   switch (elemType) {
00518   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
00519   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:  return -1;
00520   case FC_ET_POINT:    return 0;
00521   case FC_ET_LINE:     return 1;
00522   case FC_ET_TRI:      // fall through to FC_ET_QUAD
00523   case FC_ET_QUAD:     return 2;
00524   case FC_ET_TET:      // fall through to FC_ET_HEX
00525   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  // fall through to FC_ET_HEX
00526   case FC_ET_PRISM:    // fall through to FC_ET_HEX
00527   case FC_ET_HEX:      return 3;
00528   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00529   }
00530   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00531      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_ElementType"); 
00532   return -1;
00533 }
00534 
00535 /**
00536  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00537  * \brief  Returns number of vertices in a type of element.
00538  *
00539  * \description
00540  *
00541  *    Returns the number of vertices of the type of element.
00542  *    If the type is unknown (FC_ET_UNKNOWN), -1 is returned.
00543  *
00544  * \modifications  
00545  *    - Nancy Collins  Created.
00546  *    - 2003-NOV-17 WSK Changed to return numVertex instead of
00547  *      passing back out in argument list.
00548  */
00549 int fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(
00550   FC_ElementType elemType
00551 ) 
00552 { 
00553   switch (elemType) {
00554   case FC_ET_MIXED:   // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
00555   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:  return -1;
00556   case FC_ET_POINT:    return 1;   
00557   case FC_ET_LINE:     return 2;
00558   case FC_ET_TRI:      return 3; 
00559   case FC_ET_QUAD:     // fall through to FC_ET_TET  
00560   case FC_ET_TET:      return 4;
00561   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  return 5;
00562   case FC_ET_PRISM:    return 6;
00563   case FC_ET_HEX:      return 8;
00564   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00565   }
00566   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00567      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_ElementType"); 
00568   return -1;
00569 }
00570 
00571 /**
00572  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00573  * \brief  Returns number of edges in a type of element.
00574  *
00575  * \description
00576  *
00577  *    Returns the number of edges in a type of element.
00578  *    If the type is unknown (FC_ET_UNKNOWN), -1 is returned.
00579  *
00580  * \modifications  
00581  *    - Nancy Collins  Created.
00582  *    - 2003-NOV-17 WSK Changed to return numVertex instead of
00583  *      passing back out in argument list.
00584  */
00585 int fc_getElementTypeNumEdge(
00586   FC_ElementType elemType
00587 )
00588 { 
00589   switch (elemType) {
00590   case FC_ET_MIXED:     // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
00591   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:   return -1;
00592   case FC_ET_POINT:     return  0;
00593   case FC_ET_LINE:      return  1;  
00594   case FC_ET_TRI:       return  3; 
00595   case FC_ET_QUAD:      return  4;   
00596   case FC_ET_TET:       return  6;
00597   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:   return  8; 
00598   case FC_ET_PRISM:     return  9;  
00599   case FC_ET_HEX:       return 12; 
00600   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00601   }
00602   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00603      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_ElementType"); 
00604   return -1;
00605 }
00606 
00607 /**
00608  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00609  * \brief  Returns number of faces in a type of element.
00610  * 
00611  * \description
00612  *
00613  *    Returns the number of faces for a type of element.
00614  *    If the type is unknown (FC_ET_UNKNOWN), -1 is returned.
00615  *
00616  * \modifications  
00617  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
00618  *    - 2003-NOV-17 WSK Changed to return numFace instead of
00619  *      passing back out in argument list.
00620  */
00621 int fc_getElementTypeNumFace(
00622   FC_ElementType elemType
00623 ) 
00624 { 
00625   switch (elemType) {
00626   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
00627   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:  return -1;
00628   case FC_ET_POINT:    // fall through to FC_ET_LINE
00629   case FC_ET_LINE:     return 0;  
00630   case FC_ET_TRI:      // fall through to FC_ET_QUAD
00631   case FC_ET_QUAD:     return 1;
00632   case FC_ET_TET:      return 4;
00633   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  // fall through to FC_ET_PRISM
00634   case FC_ET_PRISM:    return 5;
00635   case FC_ET_HEX:      return 6;
00636   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00637   }
00638   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00639      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_ElementType"); 
00640   return -1;
00641 }
00642 
00643 /**
00644  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00645  * \brief  Returns number of the entity type in a type of element.
00646  * 
00647  * \description
00648  *
00649  *    Returns the number of the entity type for a type of element.  If the type
00650  *    is unknown (FC_ET_UNKNOWN), -1 is returned.  If the entity type is
00651  *    inappropriate (e.g. FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH on any type of element, or e.g. 
00652  *    FC_AT_FACE on for FC_ET_LINE) it returns -1. Note, passing
00653  *    FC_AT_ELEMENT will return 1.
00654  *
00655  *    For entity specific behavior see fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(),
00656  *    fc_getElementTypeNumEdge(), and fc_getElementTypeNumFace().
00657  *
00658  * \modifications  
00659  *    - 10/24/2005 WSD Created.
00660  */
00661 int fc_getElementTypeNumEntity(
00662   FC_ElementType elemType,  /**< input - Type of element */
00663   FC_AssociationType assoc  /**< Type of entity */
00664 ) 
00665 { 
00666   switch (assoc) {
00667   case FC_AT_VERTEX:         return fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
00668   case FC_AT_EDGE:           return fc_getElementTypeNumEdge(elemType);
00669   case FC_AT_FACE:           return fc_getElementTypeNumFace(elemType);
00670   case FC_AT_ELEMENT:        return 1;
00671   case FC_AT_UNKNOWN:        // fall through
00672   case FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH:     return -1;
00673   case FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET:  return -1;
00674   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00675   }
00676   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00677      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_AssociationType"); 
00678   return -1;
00679 }
00680 
00681 /**
00682  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00683  * \brief  Returns the element type of the faces of the element.
00684  * 
00685  * \description
00686  *
00687  *    For FC_ET_PYRAMID and FC_ET_PRISM the face type is a 
00688  *    mix of FC_ET_TRI and FC_ET_QUAD, so the type
00689  *    FC_ET_MIXED is return.
00690  *
00691  *    For FC_ET_POINT and FC_ET_LINE which don't have faces,
00692  *    the type returned is FC_ET_UNKNOWN.
00693  *
00694  * \modifications  
00695  *    - 02/05/04 WSK, Created.
00696  */
00697 FC_ElementType fc_getElementTypeFaceType(
00698   FC_ElementType elemType
00699 ) 
00700 { 
00701   switch (elemType) {
00702   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
00703   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:  return FC_ET_UNKNOWN;
00704   case FC_ET_POINT:    // fall through to FC_ET_LINE
00705   case FC_ET_LINE:     return FC_ET_UNKNOWN;  
00706   case FC_ET_TRI:      return FC_ET_TRI;
00707   case FC_ET_QUAD:     return FC_ET_QUAD;
00708   case FC_ET_TET:      return FC_ET_TRI;
00709   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  // fall through to FC_ET_PRISM
00710   case FC_ET_PRISM:    return FC_ET_MIXED;
00711   case FC_ET_HEX:      return FC_ET_QUAD;
00712   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00713   }
00714   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00715      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_ElementType"); 
00716   return FC_ET_UNKNOWN;
00717 }
00718 
00719 //@}
00720 
00721 /** \name Get information about an FC_DataType */
00722 //-------------------------------
00723 //@{
00724 
00725 /**
00726  * \ingroup  DataTypes
00727  * \brief  Returns the number of bytes in an FC_DataType, like sizeof()
00728  *
00729  * \description
00730  *
00731  *    Returns the size (number of bytes) of a data type.
00732  *    If the type is unknown (FC_DT_UNKNOWN), -1 is returned.
00733  *
00734  * \modifications  
00735  *    - Nancy Collins  Created.
00736  *    - 2003-NOV-17 WSK Changed to return the number of bytes instead
00737  *      of passing back out in argument list. Also asks system for size
00738  *      instead of hard coding.
00739  */
00740 int fc_sizeofDataType(
00741   FC_DataType dataType
00742 ) 
00743 {
00744   switch (dataType) {
00745   case FC_DT_UNKNOWN: return -1;
00746   case FC_DT_CHAR:    return sizeof(char);
00747   case FC_DT_INT:     return sizeof(int);
00748   case FC_DT_FLOAT:   return sizeof(float);
00749   case FC_DT_DOUBLE:  return sizeof(double);
00750   // no default case so will get warning if new values added to enum
00751   }
00752   fc_printfWarningMessage(
00753      "Warning: invalid value for enum FC_DataType"); 
00754   return -1;
00755 }
00756 
00757 //@}

00762  */
00763 FC_Dataset FC_NULL_DATASET = { -1, -1 };
00764 /** 
00765  * \ingroup  Handles
00766  * \brief Null (default) sequence handle
00767  */
00768 FC_Sequence FC_NULL_SEQUENCE = { -1, -1 };

00771  * \brief Null (default) mesh handle
00772  */
00773 FC_Mesh FC_NULL_MESH = { -1, -1 };
00774 /** 
00775  * \ingroup  Handles
00776  * \brief Null (default) variable handle
00777  */
00778 FC_Variable FC_NULL_VARIABLE = { -1, -1 };
00779 /** 
00780  * \ingroup  Handles
00781  * \brief Null (default) subset handle
00782  */
00783 FC_Subset FC_NULL_SUBSET = { -1, -1 };
